traceability.evidence: • Vitest suite (163 tests) passes, including tests referencing prompts/006.0-DEV-CONFIGURABLE-SECURITY-THRESHOLD.md: – test/filter-by-security-severity.test.js verifies blocking at/above threshold and safe cases – test/cli.flags.test.js verifies --severity accepts valid values, rejects invalid/missing values – test/functional-assessment.test.js covers invalid CLI flag exit code 2 and config file override of severity – test/cli.config-file.test.js covers reading severity from .dry-aged-deps.json and CLI override • src/cli-options.js and helpers implement parseSeverityFlag, prod/dev variants, valid values [none, low, moderate, high, critical], and exit code 2 on invalid • src/config-loader.js reads config.severity and config.prod.minSeverity/dev.minSeverity with validation against the same allowed list • src/filter-by-security.js uses thresholds to block vulnerabilities at or above the configured severity • bin/dry-aged-deps.js help text (–help) includes “--severity= Vulnerability severity threshold: none, low, moderate, high, critical (default: none)”
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for configurable security threshold are implemented and covered by concrete tests. CLI flag and config file support, valid severity levels, filtering logic, precedence (CLI > config > default), default behavior (block all), validation of invalid values, help documentation, and output of applied thresholds are present and verified.
